reasoning: Historical term for late-life depression, now classified under Major Depressive Disorder. Estimated ~180 per 100k based on MDD incidence in middle-aged/elderly adults. Moderate-low confidence due to outdated terminology and extrapolation from general MDD data.
source: Waraich P et al. (2004). Prevalence and incidence studies of mood disorders: a systematic review of the literature. Can J Psychiatry. 49(2):124-138
